conbody.p: To view running instances using euca2ools, use the following command:# euca-describe-instances <verbose>The <verbose> option can only be used by the cloud administrator. It displays all instances and not just those owned by the cloud administrator.
The output from this command will show you a number of different pieces of information:

The fields are defined as follows:
Reservation ID,
User ID who launched the instance
Security group name
Instance ID formatted as i-<nnnnnnnn>
The EMI that the instance is based on
Public and private IP addresses of the instance
Instance's status
Key pair name
Index number - if muliple instances are launched at once, they will get unique index numbers start with 0 and incrementing with each instance
vmtype
Date and time the instance was launched
Availability zone (cluster)
Kernel image the instance is based on
Ramdisk image the instance is based on
Monitoring state
Public and private IP addresses
